ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Task name
Event number
Notes: 1 = First event; 2 = Second event; 3 = Third event; etc

ElementDescription: Specify the timeframe (in the past year, past two weeks, etc.) in which elements/items are assessed
You have one minute to name as many positive potential events that may occur in your future - [event_number] event listed for next [timeframe_spec]
How vivid is the picture of the event in your mind as you envision it?
Notes: 1 = No image at all (only "knowing" that you are thinking of the event); 2 = Vague and dim; 3 = Moderately clear and vivid; 4 = Clear and reasonably vivid; 5 = Perfectly clear as vivid as normal vision

ElementDescription: How long does the event last?
Notes: 1 = Minutes; 2 = A few hours; 3 = 12-24 hours; 4 = A few days; 5 = 1 week or more

ElementDescription: How similar is this event to events you've experienced in the past?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A little; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = Quite a bit; 5 = Extremely

ElementDescription: How likely is it that this event will occur?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A little; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = Quite a bit; 5 = Extremely

ElementDescription: What are the types of emotions associated with this event?
Notes: 1 = Very negative; 2 = Negative; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Positive; 5 = Very positive

ElementDescription: How would you feel at the of the imagined future event occurring?
How much are you looking forward to this future event?
To what extent will this imagined future automatically happen?
Notes: 1 =  This imagined future will happen only if I take action; 7 = This imagined future will happen even if I don't do anything

ElementDescription: How hard would you need to try for this imagined future to come true?
Notes: 1 = I would not need to try hard at all; 7 = I would need to try very hard

ElementDescription: Number of events that meet coding criteria for "intrapersonal well-being" category
Number of events that meet coding criteria for "others' well-being" category
Number of events that meet coding criteria for "social activities" category
Number of events that meet coding criteria for "leisure" category
Number of events that meet coding criteria for "achievement" category
Number of events that meet coding criteria for "financial/home" category
Number of events that meet coding criteria for "others" category
Participants have 30 seconds to elaborate on how their event might be achieved - Degree of idealizing an effortless process to attain the desired outcome
Timepoint/visit label
Did this event happen?
How much do you feel you achieved the desired outcome?
